name: df-colinear
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ccolin, ccnv(coprab(s0, s1, s2, wrex(s3, cn, wa(w3a(wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cee, cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cee, cv(s3)))), w3o(wbr(cv(s2), cbtwn, cop(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wbr(cv(s0), cbtwn, cop(cv(s1), cv(s2))), wbr(cv(s1), cbtwn, cop(cv(s2), cv(s0)))))))))
comment: The colinearity predicate states that the three points in its arguments sit on one line. Definition 4.10 of [Schwabhauser] p. 36. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 25-Oct-2013.)
